Michael Stack wrote:
> I added this issue a while back: "[ 899909 ] Add charset detection to 
> processing".  It lists a couple of java implementations of encoding 
> recognizers including an implementation of mozilla's in java 
> (http://www.i18nfaq.com/chardet.html <-- Is this your buddy Andy?).

Well, that's funny.  No, that's not the fellow here, and indeed the 
codebase for that port doesn't look like the same one (though they're 
both from the Mozilla tree).  Ours is universalchardet 
(http://lxr.mozilla.org/mozilla/source/extensions/universalchardet/) 
versus chardet (http://lxr.mozilla.org/mozilla/source/intl/chardet/).  I 
won't try to guess the distinctions (though it's clear universalchardet 
is at least *bigger*...)   At any rate, I'll try to find out what the 
story is.

> Charset would be useful for sure but I think it comes after the heritrix 
> exploitation of the charset information supplied -- the html meta I've 
> going on about.

It's not a particular priority for us just yet, either, and I admit I 
haven't been paying much attention to where Heritrix is with that topic. 
  It just happened to come up when the fellow offered up his work, so I 
figured I'd float it.

Regards,
Andy Boyko   aboy@...
Library of Congress
